billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS

title: Increases veterans credits on competitive exams
summary: Increases from 10 to 13, the number of additional points granted to disabled veterans on competitive civil service original appointment exams; increases from 5 to 6 the number of additional points granted on promotion exams; and increases such points for non-disabled veterans from 5 to 8 on original appointment exams and from 2 1/2 to 3 1/2 on promotion exams.
currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS

       AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to  veterans  credits
         on competitive examinations

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  Subparagraphs 1 and 2 of paragraph (a) of subdivision 2 of
    2  section 85 of the civil service law, as added by chapter 790 of the laws
    3  of 1958, are amended to read as follows:
    4    (1)  Disabled veterans shall be entitled  to  receive  [ten]  THIRTEEN
    5  points  additional in a competitive examination for original appointment
    6  and [five] SIX points additional credit in a competitive examination for
    7  promotion, and
    8    (2)  Non-disabled veterans shall be entitled to receive  [five]  EIGHT
    9  points  additional  credit  in  a  competitive  examination for original
   10  appointment and [two] THREE and one-half points additional credit  in  a
   11  competitive examination for promotion.
   12    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
